title: CM Punk opens up on what it would take for him to return to WWE
text:

CM Punk has admitted it would take a lot of money for him to make a return to WWE .

The 40-year-old left the franchise on bad terms after his contract was terminated back in 2014, and has since moved into mixed martial arts.

After walking out of the company, Punk was suspended for two months and claims he was never contacted by WWE when his suspension had ended.

WWE chief executive Vince McMahon later apologised on television for the manner in which Punk's time with the brand had come to an end, but the wrestler rejected the apology and was adamant he would "never ever" return to the sport.

However it seems Punk - real name Phil Brooks - is perhaps having a change of heart if recent comments are to go by.

In response to a question on a Reddit Q&A asking if a WWE return was possible, Punk said: "It'd have to be a very big bag."

(Image: Getty Images for Queensbury Pict)

And wrestling legend Triple H admitted that the WWE would be open to providing Punk with the chance to return.

Speaking to Sky Sports ealirer this month, Triple H said: "The past is the past, you move on and everybody puts things behind them.

"If there is an opportunity to do business, Vince [McMahon] has said it a million times, we're open for business."

(Image: WWE)

Punk's dispute with WWE stems from claims he made that they mistreated an injury which he believes could have killed him.

He says he found a lump on his back which he requested be removed, but WWE physician Dr Chris Amann refused after diagnosing it as fatty deposits.

Punk says he felt pressured into continuing to perform by the WWE, and was later told the lump was an MRSA staph infection and could have been fatal.

(Image: WireImage)

A number of other gripes left him with "zero passion" for wrestling, and his latest ventures have seen him acting in movies.

He is still signed to UFC where he competes as a welterweight, and works as a commentator for Cage Fury Fighting Championships, while his relationship with the WWE seems to have improved slightly.

Punk recently tested material for FOX at WWE Backstage, before he admitted he would discuss a return to action if approached, but did not want his time to be wasted.
description: The former champion left the franchise back in 2014 and claimed at the time he would "never ever" return
